title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-5.4 - Limited permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-5.4 - Limited permits

State Regulations
(a) As
used in this section, direct supervision shall mean that, when professional
services are being rendered by the holder of a limited permit in midwifery, a
supervising licensed midwife or licensed physician who meets the requirements
of paragraph (b) (2) of this section shall be on site at all times and shall be
readily accessible and available to render physical assistance, as
required. (b) As provided in
section
6958
of the

Education Law, permits limited as to eligibility, practice, and duration shall
be issued by the department to eligible applicants as follows: (1)
A person who fulfills all requirements
for licensure as a midwife, except that relating to the examination, shall be
eligible for a limited permit as a midwife. (2)
A midwifery permitee shall be authorized
to practice only under the direct supervision of a licensed midwife as
prescribed in section
6958
(2)
of the Education Law or a licenced
physician who is board certified as an obstetrician-gynecologist by a national
certifying body or licensed physician who practices obstetrics and has
obstetric privileges at a general hospital, as defined in article 28 of the

Public Health Law. (3)

An
application for a limited permit in midwifery shall be submitted on a form
provided by the department and shall be accompanied by the statutory
fee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
79-5.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
